item.title: Profiling IoT-based Botnet Traffic using DNS
item.description: ðŸ‘¥ Owen P. Dwyer, Angelos K. Marnerides, Vasileios Giotsas, Troy Mursch ðŸ“• GLOBECOM 2019 ðŸ“„ Full paper Internet-wide security and resilience have traditionally been subject to large-scale DDoS attacks initiated by various types of botnets. Since the Mirai outbreak in 2016 myriads of Mirai-alike IoT-based botnets have emerged. Such botnets rely on Miraiâ€™s base malware code and they infiltrate vulnerable IoT devices on an Internet-wide scale such as to instrument them to perform large-scale attacks such as DDoS.
